review: went back to Red Robin in the early afternoon and it was barely busy. We were seated and waited on immediately. As I expected from Red Robin the waitress was friendly and fast. We all had different burgers and they were all good-thick and juicy. We got steak sized fries with the meals but I didn't think we got enough(love fries). It was a nice experience, relaxing at that time of day because it was empty.  Maybe I don't get out a lot but inside the door in the waiting area they have a TV embedded in the floor. You can stand on it and watch TV at the same time. Now, I have walked on floors with aquariums underneath and running streams, and flashing colored lights, but never a TV. I asked them why and said they didn't know. Must be a new trend?  Note to self:get out more

The service is always fast, the food is always great, and the atmosphere is always enjoyable. I really enjoy coming to this Red Robin location and do so often. I recently went with a large group for a friend's birthday celebration, and even with a party of 16 our waitress balanced refills and orders like a pro. I had a Caesar salad and their new vegetable soup, which was very tasty (but also very peppery - watch out!). I also regularly order their chicken tenders and their bacon burger, which always come out great. They also remember when I request no cheese with my order because of my lactose intolerance, so it's great to never have to send food back! The restaurant is pretty clean, though their menus sometimes feel a little grimy. Still, this is probably one of my favorite local places to dine out and I always leave happy!
I appreciate there decor and service but a hamburger place that doesn't serve med rare is just not right.  If they would serve burgers as customers choose it would get 4 stars.

I come here when I am craving a good Bleu Ribbon Burger.  I like their new menu and opted to to get mac n cheese instead of fries.  Not good.  Not good at all.  Very tasteless.  I also ordered a peach milk shake which was so artificial tasting that I had to send it back.  They informed me that they use a syrup for the flavor.  I got the strawberry instead with real strawberries.  Much better.  Service was great!

My husband and I were here during dinner hour on a Friday night, so it was packed. There was a HUGE line outside, but we put our name on the list and got a 15 minute wait estimate. They called us in less than five minutes- but then, we weren't there as part of a group of 15 people waiting for a birthday party seating.  Wait staff was awesome. Food was good- if you're legal, get the alcoholic Grasshopper. Totally worth the $7, plus they tell you what's in it so you can learn to make your own ;) I'd go back, and not just because I'm a sucker for the yummy steak fries.

I will admit we eat here and we like it. But we always joke about how it would be better if there weren't any children here! HA! It's all about the children here.  I like that they have a veggie burger or a Boca burger here! I like that you can get fruit instead of fries.

We have only ever stopped here and eating at the bar, so this review is based on those experiences.  They have the best bartender; he is super friendly and makes a great drink. He interacts but is not all over you. He gave some good recommendations on what to eat and the food was good. We really enjoyed the special margarita he makes.  The bar is not big and can seem very crowded, but if you can find a seat and belly up, it will be worth it!

First off -- I am a fan of Red Robin, and I would generally rank the restaurant a 4. However, I am not a fan of this particular branch. The main problem with this Red Robin is the location. It's ALWAYS so busy, and it tends to be that way no matter when you go unless it's some random time in the day that's too late for lunch and too early for dinner. However, popular, good restaurants should be busy so it's a catch-22. Unfortunately, this restaurant branch doesn't handle itself well when it's busy. It's actually funny I have to complain about the busy-ness at this particular branch because the Flat Irons location seems far more popular. Maybe it's the service that impacts this perspective? The food at this branch has always been good, but the service almost always leaves something to be desired. I've never had a bad meal, per se, but it's never been a perfect experience. There is always something wrong, and typically it's the general service. We always seem to get the bad servers that get the job done, but don't go that extra mile -- or just barely get the job done. Most of the time they are slow, unresponsive, forgetting items, etc. I gave up on buying the Freckled Lemonade because I'm lucky to get more than a glass out of it. Heck, I think I may have been asked once if I wanted more fries, and I almost never get a side of ranch for dipping when I ask for it. That's how weak the service is. When the place isn't busy, the service STILL sucks. A couple of times I was placed in the backside and the server took upwards to ten minutes just to acknowledge my presence. This is when the restaurant wasn't busy. There were people, yes, but it wasn't hopping. Another general complaint is the sound. I know that Red Robin is a family-friendly restaurant, but this particular branch seems louder than others. More screaming kids, more drunkards. More everything. There comes a point where the family aspect begins to ruin the overall ambiance and takes the fun out of going to these kinds of light-hearted affairs. The Flat Irons branch has always been great though. Good food, great service, and never overly busy. When it is busy -- the servers have always been on top of their game. Flat Irons is where I frequent now.

There is always a huge crowd because it's right next to a movie theater but they always are able to seat us with in 5 to 10 minutes. I appreciate the fact that they don't make you wait if there are only 2 people in your party and there are seats available. It's been our experience that it's much less crowded during the week days than on weekends. The burgers are amazing and the unlimited steak fries are quite a draw for my hubby. He always gets enough when we eat here. We also happened to arrive just in time for happy hour and were very pleased with the happy hour prices for drinks and wine Our wait person was super. Attentive but not hovering, just the way we like. This is definitely a place we will go back to.

1 star, but 4  Stars for the waitress.  I've been going to Red Robin since they opened way back when in Boulder.  This one needs some work.  The kitchen lost my order, and when I received my dinner (30 minutes) it was cold.  The waitress apologized, but she should have been on the kitchen after 15 min!!! She ordered a new plate and the manager brought it to me and said he hoped it was better.  Are you kidding?  He should have brought it to me (we're now at 45 min) and comped it!  He was a deer in headlights and wasn't really interested.  The other problem was that the front hostess was telling people that it was a 25 minute wait and there were numerous empty tables and just not enough wait staff??  Or maybe the cook quit??  You need to look at your management and make sure they know how to staff and how to fill the tables so the wait isn't so long.

Red Robin has classic burgers, but I wouldn't call them spectacular. The best things about Red Robin are the fries and the freckled lemonade. They have endless fries, but you do have to be persistent if you actually want more. Try the campfire sauce with them! A-maz-ing.  Another plus is that they now have gluten free buns. They also do a lettuce wrap if you want to go that route. This location is nicer than some others I have been to in the area. Service was friendly and attentive.

What happened Red Robin!? This place used to be great, but after today my husband and I will not be going back to this location. Walking in and being seated was fine untill we noticed that most the tables around us had not been bused, and even when we left the very same tables were still covered with plates and barely eaten food. The food is usually great but this time it was not. The burgers were greasey and the buns soggy. Not only that but the patties were not cooked like we asked. As for the fries, oh man. The tasted like they had been frozen, and had no flavor what so ever. Also my husband had only 9 fries, yes he counted, while I had many. The service wasn't the greatest either. Our waitress was nice but much of the time she was busy talking to her friends instead of serving us. My last complaint is that none of the wait staffed seemed to be doing anything except hanging out around the bar taking up seating.  Sorry Red Robin but you were a disappointment!

******  I have lowered my rating of this location based on the fact that the apparent owner reached out to me requesting contact information so they could get more specific details and feed back, but once I gave her contact info, never followed up.******* This was a first visit to the location.   I was really not impressed.  The food was at the same level as others I have visited in my own area, but this particular location has some issues.  Was a Saturday afternoon at about 3.  It wasn't terribly busy but we decided to sit in the bar away from the kids.   There were 2 or 3 other tables with 2-3 people at time when we entered.  Every other table was covered in dishes.   This also must be the place where the employees eat their meals.  There was 5-6 if not more hanging around the bar area and the bar, some were eating, some were chit chatting and some, including who appears to be a manager were just talking to people who were sitting at the bar.   Our visit was approximately about  1/2 hour each and every table, including the ones that people left while we were there well all still covered in dishes when we walked out.  At one point I did notice a bus person come in to the bar area, but he was quickly snapped at and demanded to come to the dining room.   Being I live 30+ miles away I won't be making a special trip.

Really good burgers, great variety, generally attentive service.  The big downside is noise and atmosphere.  Red Robin attracts families with young children.  Lots of them.  Tons of them.  Sometimes the waitstaff is overwhelmed.  We sometimes order food for pick up, and they do a great job.
Always a great burger, good service and atmosphere!  Don't forget the bottomless fries.

We eat at Red Robin a lot and this visit was exceptional.  I purchased a gift certificate for my daughter who is coming home from being out of the country and her favorite place to eat is of course, Red Robin.  I asked the server for a kiddie cup because it has a logo on it so I could do a cute present with the cards.  Cups are now plain, no logo.  Anthony went to the management and requested  a drink glass.  I could see the conversation and it was not easy, but he did it and I did not get charged the $3.00 for the glass.  He was a great server and I will sit at his station whenever I can.  And yes, he did get an extra tip.

The staff here are awesome and the service is always top notch! Toni and Eric in the bar were particularly great during our last two visits and we always enjoy coming in. Thanks for providing a nice neighborhood location to come to and relax!

During the Broncos playoffs, we heard a promotion on the radio that if they got two sacks during the game, you can go to Red Robin and get a free double tavern burger the following Tuesday.  So last night my husband and I went in to redeem the promotion, and the place was packed (like 10 - 20 minute wait). We found two seats at the bar counter and thought "cool!." The bartender/waiter was quick to ask us what we want to drink, but when we both ordered lemonade instead of alcohol, it all went downhill. He was clearly irritated that we weren't drinking, and it only got worse when he took our order. After my husband ordered, I said I wanted the Broncos promotional burger and he literally rolled his eyes and went back to the register. I had to cup my hands and practically yell at him to ask for a salad instead of fries. He was less than pleased.  The food came out timely, and I guess I got the burger I asked for, it was just overwhelmed by the bun and the meat was super thin. Nothing on the burger except cheese and special sauce. Weird.  I get it. We were a boring, cheap meal but we wouldn't have come here except for the promotion. Now we won't be coming back because of it.

When craving a burger and fries Red Robbins always nails it. Had the whiskey river burger, cooked to perfection. Went well with my Blue Moon. My server Alex K was so pleasant. We left with full stomachs and smiles on our faces. Will certainly be returning.
It's always great!! This is our favorite location! Best place to take the kiddies for an enjoyable lunch or dinner! Everyone leaves happy!

The hostesses need some customer service training.  The food was really good.  Our waitress was really good.  No free wifi.  They charged extra to exchange cheese I can see charging if you are adding.

Today my husband and I decided to get some take out so that we could enjoy the avalanche playoff game and not have to cook. I am a lifelong fan of Red Robin's French onion soup. My husband brought our food home, and to my dismay the soup was TERRIBLE. The broth was so strong, it was almost black in color. Almost as if it hadn't been diluted. Needles to say I couldn't eat it; and to top it off, I'm pregnant. I ended up having to make myself a meal anyways. I'll never be doing to go orders here again.

I love Red Robin, especially when I find the top-notch servers. You know, the ones who immediately serves you fries upon ordering your burger. The ones who are on top of your drink refills. Yes, I'm talking to you James. Did you know you can switch out your bottomless fries with bottomless sweet potato fries??? Go there, see James, enjoy.

The food and service is good as long as they are not to busy. It is a great place to get a meal before hitting up the movie theaters. You can park and walk to both. Makes for a nice and easy but enjoyable dinner and movie! I would give it a 4 Star but the food just isn't quite that good and if you catch them on a busy night the service can be a bit slow. I will say it is a good burger joint but I have a hard time rating 'burgers' above a 3 star unless the are TRULY gourmet.

Don't go here if you have a big group!! We had a group of only 15 people and came in at 6 on a Wednesday night. After being told the wait would not be too long our group was still waiting an hour later. Also after trying to look over a menu so we at least our orders could be ready a very impolite hostess snapped that there were some to go menu we could look at but she couldn't do anything else. Hoping to have had a good staff dinner we will be taking our business elsewhere for our next outing! Ridiculous service!

Burgers were good,  also had the pretzel bites (not bad). The server was friendly and smiled alot. But had to beg for silverware and found a piece of plastic wrap in our ice cream,  it also had alot of ice pieces.  Other than that not bad.

I called in a carry out order, pretty simple, two salads and they said it would take 15min. We showed up at about 15min and waited another 15-20min. They were not busy at all, and a table of employees were just hanging out together. Once we opened the salads, mine looked ok at best, but my GFs looked soupy with as much dressing they put on.  I wasn't very impressed with this location and doubtful I will return.

I'm generally pretty happy when I go to a Red Robin, but this particular store seems to have some real problems. I've been several times, and I'd say you're probably safe if you're coming in to eat at the restaurant (though, as others have mentioned, waits can be long and they're not terribly efficient at getting people seated). The real problem here is if you're trying to do carry out. I usually get onion rings instead of fries and I have yet to get the correct order. I now know I have to check my order every single time.  My last visit was the final straw though. We came in but there was a long wait. Normally, we just go to the bar and have a drink and order food to go, but this night the bar itself was full so we grabbed a table in the bar area. After 10 to 15 minutes, nobody had showed up to help us (or clean the table from the previous guest) so I stepped over to the bar to place our order. The bartender refused to take our order, saying he wasn't allowed to help guests at bar tables. He said he'd get someone over to help us, but never talked to anyone. Right as we were getting ready to leave, a waitress finally stopped by and took our order ( but never cleared or cleaned the table). Drinks took another 10 to 15 minutes to arrive with the food taking at least another 15 minutes after that. Sure enough, the order was wrong but now we couldn't find our waitress to fix it or give us our tab ( wouldn't you leave a tab when you drop a to go order with a customer?!) I walked around the place trying to find our waitress but never did see her again. Found a manager who placed our order up under the hot lights to be fixed where it proceeded to sit for another 15 minutes. At this point I'm so stunned that I just have to see what happens. I'm assuming they're remaking our order, but no. Someone finally pulls my burger off the window for a few seconds to dump the fries and fill it with onion rings. I seriously doubt they replaced the burger with a fresh one (our order is at least a half hour old at this point), but I suppose it's possible they did. I couldn't see it to tell but I do know our other burger wasn't remade. I could have looked if they'd ever brought it back to us, but it just sat there. After another 10 minutes, all if could do was laugh. I seriously looked around for cameras to see if I was being punked. The service couldn't have been worse if they were doing this on purpose. Still hadn't received a tab so I handed the bartender enough to cover our drinks as I walked out the door.  I certainly won't go back here, but I'm trying to decide whether I can ever bring myself to go to a Red Robin again. (It really hurts to give this place the second star, but I did have several decent experiences here when dining in)

Love love red robin! Bottomless steak fries! The new decor is great. Well updated! And definitely much needed.  Red royalty card is a huge plus. 10th burger is free. Free birthday burger. Good discounts.  Always have good service. Management is attentive and make table touches to make sure everything is good throughout the meal  Only down side is its ALWAYS cold in the restaurant

My experience echoes many of the other reviews -- this location is poorly managed producing inconsistent food and inadequate service.  We had dirty utensils, no draught beer was available and we had to retrieve our bottled beers from the bar ourselves, our food took over 25 minutes to be served and wasn't hot.  I normally count on Red Robins to be good places to eat, but not this one.

Good service, nice waiter, but terrible quality of food. My boyfriend's burger was like, a pile of lumpy meat, like some of the patty was missing. I think they serve better bacon at McDonald's. I ordered the boneless wings. Barely had any sauce. Would have preferred McDonald's nuggets. The kid's pizza was under cooked and crappie. Booo your food Red Robin

Rude server and cold fries. Asked for 2 basket of fries for our party and server told me"I'll get those when I can" and then you can tell she split the baskets as there was barely any and then ice cold! Rude rude rude! Red robin in the orchard sucks! I wish I could of given them a zero
We get good service here but this time was a different experience. We sat for 18 minutes without being spoken to it was dead in there. The food is good but the service has went down hill.

We frequent this Red Robin because it is a good place to go before or after seeing a movie at the nearby theater. This means we usually go on a weekend when it is quite crowded but my husband and I decided to go on a Monday night for a quiet dinner.  We arrived around 6 pm. The restaurant was about half full and we were seated immediately. Our waitress was efficient, very no nonsense. Service was good but impersonal . She visited our table several times during the meal and drinks were refilled promptly, but she did not offer any of the usual small talk or chit chat which, depending on your preference could be a good or bad thing.  We ordered the onion ring tower appetizer which came quickly. The onion rings were crisp and hot and our burgers came before we were even finished with them. Food came put very fast this night. Our burgers were both cooked to medium as per request. My husband had a bacon cheeseburger and I had a guacamole bacon burger. Wish they had put a little more guac on it but it was good. The steak fries were hot and as always bottomless.  We also have a Red Robin loyalty card which I usually remember to present when we get our check. I never keep track of how many times we eat at RR but lo, last night we bought our 10th burger so we got one free, which was a nice surprise.  All in all, going on a weekday night turned into a good experience. No waiting and super fast service!

this place can get insanely loud, crowded, and chaotic on the weekends. pretty much an introvert's nightmare.. but i say that in a factual, non-judgy way, because sometimes that's what you're in the mood for. it's a great burger joint for the family. stop in for that occasional splurge on greasy, traditional american food. get your burger and fries on. get the little ones a balloon. enjoy the fun atmosphere.  and perhaps tip a little extra if your waitstaff did a good job - i can only imagine how the endless noise and family mess cleanup can be a bit wearing day in and day out.

Food and staff great, but I find it deplorable that their assigned shifts are tied to those "online reviews" on your receipt....and anything other than "strongly agree" doesn't count....  Their management should be canned for treating their employees this way.

5 of us for dinner tonight and I wonder why we keep going back... My burger didn't really taste like meat and my salad was wilted. I never received a refill of my iced tea. It has been a few months since. We were there last. That time our waitress spent time clearing tables and let our food sit in the window. When she finally brought our food she failed to bring napkins and utensils. That took 5 minutes to get a buster to bring then to us. very consistent Horrible!!! food and service...

This is a very nice Red Robin's! I went for lunch on Easter Sunday & was actually surprised to see so many people there on a holiday.  I had the Southern Charm Burger. I think it was a Maple glaze Angus burger with candied bacon, etc. A little sweet but good. I probably Robin's very it again but only because I like my burgers to be more savory than sweet.  As usual, the fries were delicious & bottomless but I didn't finish my first round.

The food was alright. Not impressed with our waiter what so ever. Asked for a few things off the burger, and it came out with it on, never had a drink refill or asked how we were doing. Took our order, gave us food and the bill and left. Not satisfied with the service at all!

Just ate dinner  What a disaster cold as an ice box and manager said he has no local control of the air and my kids were disappointed no more refills on Mac and cheese but no reduction in the cost and service was slow,with an attitude
We only sit in the bar since we have no kids and they have great burgers and the bottomless fries are wonderful. Drinks are a good deal during happy hour. Best onion rings in town..

The Good: Amazing burgers and endless steak fries, how can you not like that? The service was great and the price is good. Even though Burger Works is a Red Robin restaurant it doesn't even compare. The Bad: There aren't many Red Robins north of I-70 so you have to be ready to drive. It is definitely worth the drive.  The Ugly: Hard to find something ugly about this experience, but I had to pick something it would probably be the Reggae / Hipster server with the dreads and the lazy eye. Wasn't sure if he was talking to me or the table behind me.

Service has been consistently bad for us when we came here the last two times. I've been to other Red Robin locations and have had much better experiences but this particular one seems to just drop the ball when it starts getting busy.  The last time we came was on a Saturday for dinner. We had a party of 8 and everything seemed to be going well until we realized the kitchen was behind. Once the waitress also realized the kitchen was backed up she pretty much avoided us. In the end the adults got their food first and the children got their meals last. When we asked the waitress for some fries to help keep the kids happy she was visibly annoyed. We got our food about an hour after ordering, while the kids received theirs about 15 mins later.  Maybe it's a different story when it's not so busy but I would definitely avoid this place at peak dinner times.

Ordered a Smoke and Pepper which is on of their premium burgers. Asked for a little pink. The burger came out beyond well done and crunchy on the edges. The bacon looked and tasted like it had been made in the morning, we were there a little after nine. The fries were also just the little curved ends. You should never serve those! I made a review on the table Kiosk and they said they wanted to send me an email for a burger in depth review, nothing ever showed up. Will no longer have Red Robin as a restaurant choice.

Disappointing. I had the bonzai burger. The burger was overdone. And forgive me if I'm wrong, but the burger size seems to have shrunk. The bun still very large, but the meat content inside is much thinner than I remember. The last Red Robin that I ate at had a much larger Patty. My burger was also cold upon arrival. And the bottom bun was soggy.
The food was good but they scam you with a fee for using the tablets on every table.  Do they really need to use this scam to extract another $1.99 from the guests?

Service is good. However, my wife ordered burger and fries. Burger was very rare not what she asked for.  I ordered fish and chips. Chips were sweet potato fries. They came out cold. They brought out new burger and luke warm fries.  Not cool when there prices are what they are!

So usual a big fan of the burgers but this location just seems to not be paying attention to detail. .. Went with 3 buddy's and from start to finish everything was just screwed up or just wrong.... I ordered a diablo style burger with an over easy egg. ... egg of course was wrong and burger was wrong size why they  have 3 sizes I don't understand... salad had wrong dressing and burger was room temperature. .. smh...my 2 buddies both got either the wrong condomientes or wrong size of burger..... the staff fixed the problem but it just added to the wait... I think this place could be 5 stars but details are it's week points... drinks were  refilled but with wrong soda..  no big deal but just another small thing..

Our server Madison was a well trained server, met all our expectations when we go out for a meal. This location was very busy but she never forgot about us. We haven't been here for awhile but it was a nice change of pace. Even with a free "birthday burger" it was still  $38.   But then again it's not McDonald's.

The wait staff was overworked.  They had too many customers to attend to... and this was noon on a Wednesday.   The waitress we had was very nice, she just had too many tables.  We ordered the chips, salsa, and guac for $5. I was very disappointed to see only 10 chips arrived, along with a small tablespoon of salsa, and a tablespoon of guac. My son said that we could get refill on the chips. Sure enough, the 10 chips went fast. We received more chips, but the manager rudely said that the guac and salsa could not be refilled. I told him to take the extra chips away then, there is no point in plain chips. He then walked away pissed off, and came back with more salsa and guac. Seriously,  they charge  $5 for 10 chips and two tablespoons of salsa and guac!!!  The meal portions were ok, just ok.  I hope the kind waitress quickly moves on to a different establishment. We will not return.   To any Red Robin. This was my first time to one in a decade.

Stopped in here for dinner with my family, as odd as it sounds, none of us had really ever tried the food at Red Robin. Pretty much everything on the menu looked really good and trust me, there are plenty of creative gourmet  style hamburgers and chicken sandwiches to choose from. My gut was telling me to get get the Mad Love burger which was a half-pound patty with bacon, guacamole, jalapeño relish, provolone and Swiss cheese, but for some reason I chose the prime rib dip. Bad call.... The prime rib dip was okay, but nothing special. The prime rib tasted decent, but the sandwich was really small and probably belonged on the lunch menu, according to its size. At $15 it definitely should've been bigger. At least now I know to get the Mad Love burger next time I go.  The service was average, but i definitely like the decor of the restaurant. I'll give this place another shot in the future and will order a burger for sure, and we'll see if I can update this review and add a star or two.. Stay tuned foodies!

Great early dinner with my wife... Everything was very good, served quickly, and my burger was customized to perfection. The side salad was cold, crisp, and "bottomless" for only $2. Great milk shakes too... Kids will love this place. Highly Recommended!
Pretty good, but I try to avoid ordering a burger here because whenever I order it well done, it usually seems to have some pink which I don't like.

Wanted a burger. Red the menu. Made a selection. Noted "Customize your burger any way you like no charge" with a long list of options. When I went to order my "Guacamole bacon burger" I was going to elect for the grilled chicken patty switched, jalapeño bun, pepper jack cheese, and onion straws. I was interrupted about an up-charge amongst the small list of changes I had hoped to make to achieve maximum burger deliciousness. I decided it was not worth the effort arguing with this employee about this exchange and decided not to eat. Better luck next time Red. Lost a $12 over priced burger sale over a nickels worth of fried onion straws.  The rest of the party was satisfied with there pre determined topping burgers. And all good was to there satisfaction. Hence 2 stars not one.

The trick is to sit in the bar...which you can only do if everyone in your party is 21 or older.  Last night everyone was, so yay, got to enjoy Red Robin without the birthday party singing and clapping!  And what really turned this experience from a 3 start to a 4 was our server (I'm going to say Kirsten because that is the name on the receipt).  Assuming this is Kirsten, we have had the pleasure of sitting in her section the last three or four times.  She is absolutely the best, most positive, most experienced and efficient server -- not just here, but anywhere! The food was good: starter of boneless chicken wings were tasty and paired nicely with a Fat Tire draft.  Entrees included a burger and salad (substitute for fries) and fish and chips.  The "bottomless" steak fries I can take or leave, but the tartar sauce with the awesome and not greasy fish is the best I've had anywhere.  And a generous portion at that. It was a bit cold in there, and I absolutely hate those on-table screens for payment and whatever else (so ours sat on the bench next to me), but I have to say I kind of understand why there is always a crowd gathered in front of this location in the Orchard Town Center.

We were looking forward to eating a burger here but the service was terrible, the food was marginal.  When they didn't make the right burger for my wife they told her they would do a new burger but the burger they brought was way over done and probably the one they tried to serve her recooked. Not going back to Red Robin.

Such a great place to bring kids and eat burgers!  They were busy tonight and brought on their "A" game!  We brought our two year old, which we rarely do anymore, and there was no drama, frustration, or crying child. Our waitress, Gaby, was so sweet. Even when our two year old turned some alarm on... never mind about that!  We got the protein burger, children's MAC and Cheese, and the "Mad Love" burger. Everything was perfect. And when we had to get the bill quickly, even though they were packed, Gaby got it taken care of with a smile!  Thank you Red Robin!! Wonderful Friday evening!  I knew we could count on you!
Burgers were awesome. Our waitress Ayla was very friendly and attentive.  Who doesn't like the unlimited fries. I have some here a few tines and always received great food and helpful staff.

I like this place for a quick bite before a movie. The food is consistent not amazing. The burgers are good everything else is okay. Service is also good but I just can't get used to using the little computer thingy to order drinks apps and desserts. I suppose that I'm old fashioned but if I am expected to tip I would like the server's to be attentive. If the service industry wants to automate the industry more then they should structure their pay different. Now I'm ranting. LOL. But really the food is good and I've never had any issues in all the times I have been here. Keep up the great work.

Went here for Mother's day last minute, because Texas Roadhouse was not accommodating AT ALL to my large family. The host at Red Robin was awesome, and the servers were wonderful! We had 24 people.... 12 were Kids.... and they got us in under a half an hour. Food for everyone was amazing, and fast. Thank you all, it was a great dinner!!!

Excellent Service!  Yes!  Nanette was wonderful to our jokingly sarcastic party of 5!  We enjoyed our time of never ending root beer floats during a very busy Saturday evening at Red Robin. Thanks again, Nanette! You made our night!

From start to end bad experience. I walked in my name was never taken just to wait a few moment I waited as others where sat. Finally was taken to my table and it was still not wiped down. After about 10 min our waitress came brought our drinks and we waited another 15 minutes before we were approached again. Food was horrible. And to top off our evening there where flies everywhere. Wouldn't suggest it .

Took family Wednesday for dinner.  Came early 4:30. Ordered appetizer. Never came. Took 40 minutes for dinner to hit table.  Appetizer came with dinner. I told them to stick it where sun don't shine!   Loud miserable service slow poor joint. Ain't never coming back.  4 of our five times her because children like, have been awful adventures.

This place gets busy very fast. They have a wide range of burgers. The burgers taste really good and fresh ingredients. And you get bottomless fries. The service was slow. It was just really crowded and the server only checked on us like one time. We paid on the table ipad thing and left. Maybe we will get better service next time. Or have more servers staffed.

Usually Red Robin is my favorite casual burger place, but today I was served by a bartender named Ryan who may have turned me off from this location permanently. I came to watch football and first noticed the issue when the screen was significantly obstructed by his hair, this dreadlocked nightmare looked like rats were living in it and clumped feet above his head. This was a sanitary nightmare, the man is responsible for making all the milkshakes in the restaurant and sure enough the longer I sat the more bits of drippy milkshake I could see on his dangling, disgusting, locks.  The hairy milkshake issue seems straight out of an FDA instructional video of how not to prepare safe food.  It is baffling to me how management could allow an employee to have such obviously unsanitary attire, they are placing all their guests at risk with such poor health standards.
